RACE.RACE_TEXT: SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 37000. (PLUS UP TO $1,480 ATB) FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $30,000. Three Year Olds, 115 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 25, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 25, 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HAPPY SAILOR bid for the lead from the inside, gained command around the five eighths pole, was in a steady drive throughout the turn, then drew off in the stretch and held on well to prevail. TURN ON THE BLING tracked the pace while three wide, then came out four wide on the turn to rally in the stretch and was closing strong and was best for second. WAVING BYE stalked the pace while three wide down the backstretch, then bid on the turn to menace in the stretch and was closing well just missing the place prize in the end. PROUD VALENTINE bid for the lead from the three path down the early backstretch, then pressed the pace while two wide into the turn, was in a hard drive in the early stretch then gave way in the end. BLUSHING BELLE chased the pace along the inside at one speed throughout the course and needed more in the end. TOOTIE broke outwardly and bumped rival then was unhurried early and no menace. KELLEY SAID READY lead the way from the gate then settled back in the middle of the field while two wide, and had no final bid in the end. KEEP THE BLING was unhurried early and needed rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Keep the Bling
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside, needed rally

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Sailor
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, lead 5/8, steady drive, drew off, held

ENTRY.NAME: Blushing Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, bid turn, one pace, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Tootie
ENTRY.OWNER: Williams Justin and Dupuy Allen C
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bumped, unhurried early, bid 2 wide turn, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Turn On the Bling
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied upper, closed well, up for second

ENTRY.NAME: Kelley Said Ready
ENTRY.OWNER: Penn Family Racing Clifton Kevin and Bradley Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2 wide, settled back, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Valentine
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3 wide, press 2 wide, hard drive turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Waving Bye
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalk 3 wide, menace stretch, closed well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 73. Maiden Special Weight Purse 35000. (PLUS UP TO $5,950 ATB) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, AND FIVE YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 115 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $20,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CURLIN SERENADE dueled for the lead while inside, was well handled then drew off and held sway in teh end. MADAMOUSSEPOUSSE chased the pace while saving ground on the turn, was inside for the stretch drive and was gaining ground to finished well. GLORY O dueled for the lead while two wide into the turn, was in a long drive but faltered in late stretch. WILD EXPRESS was unhurried early and inside into the turn, made a mild rally but was no threat. HAPPY IN HEELS chased the early pace while three wide into the turn, was used up then gave way in the stretch. TARKINGTON GIRL raced three wide on the turn then faltered in the drive. GOOD LIQUOR was unhurried early on the was no threat. SECRET PASS was outrun. AZUSA STREET trailed throughout.

ENTRY.OWNER: Evans, Johnny B. and Eoff, Terry
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside turn, mild rally, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin Serenade
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, inside, well handled, drew off, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Glory O
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, 2 wide turn, long drive, faltered,

ENTRY.NAME: Good Liquor
ENTRY.OWNER: Charlton, V. Joan and Charlton, Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Madamoussepousse
ENTRY.OWNER: Mazoch Linda Mazoch Michael J and Gustafson Austin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, inside, saved ground, bid, finished well,

ENTRY.NAME: Happy in Heels
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 3 wide turn, used up, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Tarkington Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3 wide turn, faltered,

ENTRY.NAME: Azusa Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Star of Texas S. SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 106. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee. $500 due at time of entry. Starters to pay an additional $500. $2,000 Supplemental nominations may be made at time of entry and shall include all fees. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes at a mile in 2022 - 2023 allowed 3 lbs. Non-winnersof two races at a mile since September 25, 2022 allowed 5 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming and Starter races not considered in weight allowances.) This race will be limited to ten starters with preference to horses with highest earnings in 2022-2023 at time of entrry . Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD PILOT was settled while inside on the backstretch, rallied on the far turn while three wide making a strong bid, was in long drive and dug in gamely to be all out in deep stretch to prevailed in the end. DUST EM was hard to load then sent to the front and set a well rated pace, was in a gamely strong drive in the stretch but was out finished in the end. BLING'S BELLWETHER was unhurried early then started a run on the far turn, moved out to be two wide for the stretch drive but was no menace in late stretch. QUARTERBACK DAK stalked the pace while three wide on the backstretch, was used up then gave way in the drive. JOSH'S DREAM pressed the pace while two wide on the backstretch, was hard used then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Bling's Bellwether
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild rally, 2 wide stretch, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Pilot
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied, 3w 2nd turn, long drive, all out late

ENTRY.NAME: Dust Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load, set pace, well handled, gamely inside, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: Josh's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, hard used, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Quarterback Dak
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide backstretch, used up, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Texas Thoroughbred Association Oaks SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 75. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED & TTA SALE GRADUATE, FILLIES, THREE YEARS OLD. $500 to pass the entry box and an additional $500 to start. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the win ner, 20% to the second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: 122 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than Maiden or Claiming allowed 5 lbs. The field will be limited to twelve starters with prefer ence to horses with highest lifetime earnings at the time of entry. Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presen ted to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SANTA FE GOLD was sent to the front to set a well rated pace, drew away in upper stretch and was clearly much the best in the end. NEW DESTINY chased the early pace while two wide on the backstretch, rallied into the far turn two wide but was no match for the winner in the stretch. PIVOSKY was unhurried early then raced on the inside down the backstretch, made a mild gain in the stretch but was no threat. DIAMOND GRAND stalked the pace while three wide on the backstretch, made a bid then faltered in the drive. REASON OVER RICHES lunged at the start then was allowed to settled, raced three wide in the stretch and failed to menace. CHA CHA DANCER was allowed to settled then raced two wide on the backstretch then faltered in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Pivosky
ENTRY.OWNER: Mazoch, Michael J. and Mazoch, Linda
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside backstretch, mild gain, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: New Destiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2 wide, bid, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Reason Over Riches
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged start, settled, 3 wide stretch, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Santa Fe Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, well rated, drew off upper stretch, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Cha Cha Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2 wide backstretch, faltered,

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide backstretch, bid, faltered,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: San Jacinto Turf S. SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Turf CR: 93. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED FILLIES AND MARES, FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. No nomination fee. $500 due at time of entry. Starters to pay an additional $500. $2,000 Supplemental nominations may be made at time of entry and shall include all fees. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to the second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes at a mile or over in 2022 - 20 23 allowed 3 lbs. Two races at a mile or over since September 25, 2022 allowed 5 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming and Starter races not considered in weight allowances) This race will be limited to twelve starters with preference to horses with highest earnings in 2022-2023 at time of entry. Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMALUCKYCHARM set a pressured pace from the inside, was well handled then drew off turning for home, was in a strong drive and held sway in the end. NO MAS TEQUILA chased the early pace while two wide on the backstretch, made a bid and was gaining ground in late stretch but was too late. TUDELA chased the early pace while inside on the backstretch, saved ground on the far turn then made a bid but was no menace in late stretch. ROSIE JANE was unhurried early on then made a mild rally in the stretch and was no threat in the stretch drive. TAHITIAN BREEZE broke a step slow then was allowed to settled, raced two wide on the far turn then failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Tudela
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, inside backstretch, saved ground, no menace late

ENTRY.NAME: No Mas Tequila
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2 wide, bid gaining late stretch, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Tahitian Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, allowed to settle, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Rosie Jane
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild rally, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Imaluckycharm
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, inside, well handled, drew off, held sway

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Spirit of Texas S. SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 92. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee. $500 due at time of entry. Starters to pay an additional $500. $2,000 Supplemental nominations may be made at time of entry and shall include all fees. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining purse to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes in 2022 - 2023 allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of two racessi nce September 25, 2022 allowed 5 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming and Starter races not considered in weight allowances.) This race will be limited to fourteen starters, with preference to horses with highest earnings in 2022-2023 at time of entry. Horses not draaw ing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOO MUCH ACTION chased the early pace while inside down the backstretch, rallied and was two wide turning for home, was blocked behind rivals then split foes and moved back to the inside, dug in gamely and was up in the final strides. ALGEBRA pressed the pace while two wide into the turn, rallied in upper stretch and was in a long sustained drive then dug in gamely in late stretch but was out finished in the final strides. MR MONEY BAGS chased the early pace while two wide into the turn, rallied and was three wide in upper stretch, was in a long drive in the stretch but hung in late stretch. SUNDAY BLING set a pressured pace from the inside, was in a long drive then gamely dug in but tired in late stretch. CHAMPAGNE STOOPER was unhurried early then raced two wide on the turn and was no menace. SCORE KEEPER was unhurried early and outrun throughout. MY GOLDEN M was unhurried early while inside then was no threat.

ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, outrun,

No nomination fee. $500 due at time of entry. Starters to pay an additional $500. $2,000 Supplemental nominations may be made at time of entry and shall include all fees. The Purse to be d ivided: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining Purse to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes in 2022 - 2023 allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of two races since September 25, 2022 allowed 5 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming and Starter races not considered in weight allowances.) This race will be limited to fourteen starters with preference to horses with highest earnings in 2022-2023 at time of entry.H orses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IMA DISCREET LADY was stalking the pace while three wide into the turn, rallied on the turn then w2aited for an opening in upper stretch staying three wide, split rivals then was in a strong drive to draw off in late stretch. LADY AVE chased the early pace while four wide into the turn, rallied on the outside to take command in mid stretch but could not last in late stretch. HEAVENLY RHYTHM was unhurried early on then started a run on the turn, was moved out to be five wide for the stretch drive and closed willingly in late stretch to finished well. UPTOWNBLINGITHOME was chasing the pace while inside and saving ground on the turn, tried to slipped through in upper stretch and was blocked then steadied sharply just before the furlong marker, angled outside to be two wide and was gaining ground in late stretch. TAKE CHARGE WOMAN was well placed while two wide into the turn, rallied and made a strong bid then faltered in late stretch. TOLONDA dueled for the lead while inside into the turn, was in a long drive then faltered in upper stretch. TEXAS ASCOT QUEEN was unhurried early then failed to menace. BOERNE dueled for the lead while two wide, was used up and through early then gave way.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Richard King Turf S. SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 8 1 1/8M Turf CR: 108. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee. $500 due at time of entry. Starters to pay an additional $500. $2,000 Supplemental nominations may be made at time of entry and shall include all fees. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weight: 123 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes at a mile or over in 2022 - 2023 allowed 3 lbs. Non-w inners of two races at a mile or over since September 25, 2022 allowed 5 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming and Starter races not considered in weight allowances.) This race will be limited to twelve starters with preference to horses with highest earnings in 2022-20 23 at time of entry. Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUNLIT SONG stalked the pace while two wide on the backstretch, rallied on the far turn and was in a long hard drive and prevailed in the end. BUBBA BLING was allowed to settled while three wide on the backstretch, was used up and gave way.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Texas Thoroughbred Association Derby SAM HOUSTON RACE PARK RACE 9 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TEXAS ACCREDITED & TTA SALE GRADUATE, COLTS AND GELDINGS, THREE YEARS OLD. $500 to pass the entry box and an additional $500 to start. The Purse to be distributed: $1,000 to all starters sixth through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the winner, 20% to the second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: 122 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstakes allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than Maiden or Claiming allowed 5 lbs. The field will be limited to twelve startersw ith preference to horses with highest lifetime earnings at the time of entry. Horses not drawing a starting position in the gate will receive a refund of the entry fee. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. A trophy will l be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RELEASE MCCRAKEN was shuffled back into the first turn then settled while two wide on the backstretch, rallied and moved out to be four wide in upper stretch, responded with a strong drive and drew away in late stretch. SEND THE BOSS was settled while inside and stalking the pace on the backstretch, rallied and made a bid two wide, angled out off heels in mid stretch to be four wide and closed ground willingly in late stretch. FUNNY UNCLE pressed the pace while two wide on the backstretch, rallied to take command on the far turn to mid stretch then faltered in the drive. VIETNAM VICTORY stalked the pace while three wide on the backstretch, rallied on the far turn making a bid to mid stretch then flattened out in late stretch. GUITAR BOY raced four wide on the first turn and backstretch, rallied on the far turn but flattened out in the drive. LEGAL EAGLE was unhurried early and inside then was no threat. TAPITURE JONES set a pressured pace while inside on the backstretch, was used up and gave way. I'M A COWBOY was shuffled back early on then settled and was no threat. MOR VICTORY was unhurried early and no threat.

ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside, no threat,
